The composition of flu vaccines is guided by the World Health Organization's recommendations and is decided in meetings where the US Food and Drug Administration participates.
Thimerosal: a mercury-containing organic compound, is used as a preservative in some vaccines, but it is cleared from the human body more quickly than the type of mercury found in certain fish.
